author: {'steamid': '76561198069369321', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1640256946}
review: I used to play Mad Freebording a lot when I was younger, it was pretty fun to get a high score and improve your runs. Seeing as this game was made by the same developer but now with a bit more experience under his belt I thought I was going to find something nice. I wasn't expecting the best game ever but something small and fun to past the time. But nope, the game feels very cheap. It has very few levels and the physics don't feel quite right. It has community levels but frankly they suck. I really wanted to enjoy it but even with a discount it feels like a waste of time. I can't believe this used to be a lot more expensive too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216138257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1621806204}
review:
I'm a simple person, I see a beefcake werewolf on a snowboard doing SSX style tricks and I'm tossing money at whatever will get such power into my hands. Having spent a little under an hour playing this game to it's fullest extent, I feel as if my furry trashiness has been my undoing.

This feels like one of those 3D Groove Shockwave games from years ago like Lenny Goes Snowboarding or Santa Butt Boarding. It's  primitive, bland and egregiously short. However, unlike those games from years ago at the dawn of 3D gaming over the internet, this game has a lot less going on because they under-utilize the space they have.

For each of the four levels or so I played, you had time attack and score attack and that's it. Usually games of this style would include a crapton of stuff to do like hunting down McGuffins, trick link challenges, hidden spots to find, maybe an alternate board or costume to aim for. This game does none of these things and aside from unlocking characters(Of which the werewolf was last in line, of course) which took the better part of twenty minutes anyway, there's nothing else for you to look forward to.

The level editor and user created levels are the only saving grace and considering the majority of the levels that I found were just giant bowls or straight lines with a goal plopped down somewhere presumably with the intent to grind out EXP, that's not saying a lot.

I bought this on sale for about two bucks and I can say beyond a doubt that That was about the right asking price for this. It's barely a trial game with only user created levels to keep you coming back. Unless you're furry trash like me, then you'll get maybe one or two more plays out of it once you unlock the werewolf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068224670', 'num_games_owned': 3658, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1510702656}
review: This game is fun but the reason why I'm giving it a thumbs down is because it is overpriced (it's a mobile game port) and the main aspect of the game, which are the community levels, can't be played because the developers didn't bothered to keep this game updated on steam thus making them impossible to play because everyone made the levels on the mobile version and you "don't have the updated version"

review:
Tags: Driving & Racing
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: XBox360 pad support is partial, does not work in menus. Every map feels identical to the last with heavy asset recycling. Play Riptide GP2 for better execution of similar gameplay.
http://store.steampowered.com/app/257790/Riptide_GP2/

Tiny bit of unity engine winter assets floating in some rather low quality skybox. You gain speed and momentum at a silly, completely unrealistic pace. You get plenty of occasion to do flips but the system to do moves is primitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203407209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1461636176}
review: Are there worse bare bones Unity games? Yes. Does that mean Mad Snowboarding is worth $8.99? No. If only a little more work had gone into it to make things more complex and interest, it could be a decent budget title. Hell, it could be a decent budget title I'd happily give a thumbs up to if it was much cheaper, but frankly, there's a sea of better stuff you could spend that money on. Mad Snowboarding just does not give you enough bang for your buck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052935907', 'num_games_owned': 1995, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1460204201}
review:
Ugh. Like probably everyone else that bought this game or had it wishlisted, I was hoping for an SSX-type of game -- in my case for the open world racing, as I don't care about tricks. Unfortunately, with those expectations in mind, Mad Snowboarding ended up being a huge disappointment.

Note that I only played this for about half an hour, but it says something that by the end, playing to see what else this game offered was was quite a chore -- I would even characterize it as painful. I was bored out of my mind. In the levels I played, the world was very plain and dull. It isn't as "open" as it looks, and I quickly ran into "walls" when going not that far left or right. This is basically a really, really boring demo.

In my case, I bought this as a spare bundle key for about $0.20, so I'm not crying. But I would definitely encourage anyone wanting to pay full price to watch a lot of videos of this game and reading some of the more critical reviews before pulling the trigger.

Again, I only played half an hour, but half an hour into a game ... if it is that painfully boring, I find it hard to believe that the game would change dramatically after that. Maybe those creative types who enjoy designing stages and playing user-created levels will get more enjoyment out of it.

Seriously, why doesn't EA bring the SSX series to Steam? Even a port of an older SSX game will do. As it is, I suspect a lot of people will pick Mad Snowboarding up on sale to satisfy their SSX itch and end up disappointed.

1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064850410', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1456026546}
review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Denis Lapiner 
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Denis Lapiner 
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Sept 2015
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Snowboarding, Racing
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #Worth
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]
I rode a banana down a mountain as a monkey. 

I was hoping for some sort of approximation of an SSX game in this. I've wanted a decent snowboarding game on PC ever since I can remember. 

This... is what I want? Stay with me. 

This game FEELS almost good. It ALMOST feels like an SSX game. I think this game suffers a bit from what I call the Coolboarders syndrome in where you remember it being good and enjoying it. But in retrospect you didn't. Not at all. And enough time has passed where you only remember thinking you had fun. Only that all happens within minutes.

This is a mobile port with some added controls which is fine. There are plenty of great mobile games, the platform itself is not indicative of poor quality. Although maybe for the genre it is. Overambitious. The game is very simple. It works. The UI is very large and very bubbly for obvious reasons of mobile gaming. 

There is a split screen multiplayer. But in all honesty I'm not sure why you would do such a thing to your friends. You might not use that as a designation for each other afterwords.

There is also a level editor that isn't terrible; it is sufficient in making a level that is noticeably different than other ones. The thing is, this game is trying to hard. Its trying to do everything and thus only does those things sub par if at all. Everything is functional at best. 

I was truly surprised when I went back to visit the store page to have it revealed to me that this was not still in early access. What even more surprising is I have had more enjoyment from this game than SNOW. But that story is for another time. 

I am honestly torn about this game. It feels good. Sort of. Good enough. Its silly, it has the strange and goofy characters needed to maintain that sentiment. It reminds me a little of TrackMania in the way that if this game had a larger community there could be a plethora of insane crazy stages that mess with the physics and probably some other ideas that people who are more creative than me can come up with. The thing is, its kind of a barren wasteland. And for that reason I cannot recommend this game without that level of curation or group of creators backing it constantly making new levels. And in all honesty I don't see it developing that audience. It needed that from the get go. You can't manufacture interest I suppose.

[b]THE GIST
This game is totally fine as a product that exists and can be purchased. But for many reasons I HIGHLY recommend that you do not purchase it. Go eat a sandwich instead. You'll come away from that experience much more fulfilled. Pun intended.[/b]

[quote]More here — [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28295405/]Station Argus[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198144681236', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1450558164}
review:
Do you like open world games where you attempt to reach the finish while trying to do awesome stunts in the meantime?If yes this is the game for you.I might have not played that much due to not having any free time ubt here is my opinion

Pros:
Has multiplayer
Has co-op
Has a lot of modes to play
Has level editor (this makes the possibilities endless
It is a great time killer for people like me
It is great fun to play even by yourself
Gives you the option to play with a joystick and a keyboard
Controls are easy to get used to


Cons: 
It might be a bit pricy for some people


Overall this game has a lot of potential and it can be a great way to spend your free time.I would give it an 8/10.
Now lets go to thethings i would personally like to see be added:

Currency:You get it throughout the map in the from of coins/shards and it is used for trading in a Yeti shop for new boards,cosmetics,single-use powerups for better scores or even map packs with a bunch of cool stages.

Wildlife:Animals like bears or penguins running around making you fail if you bump into them

Boss-type stages:A giant yeti chases you with a snowboard and you have to outrun it and finish before it catches you/Escape an avalance or types of stages like that.

Thank you mod for making this awesome game and i hope you consider my ideas worthy of using.Keep  up te great work

author: {'steamid': '76561198042773412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1442786538}
review:
Nigdy nie sądziłem że ta gierka jakkolwiek przykuje moją uwagę ale... tak właśnie się stało.

Jest to naprawdę niezła, choć stosunkowo prosta gierka o snowboardingu. Wybieramy jedną z odblokowanych postaci, wybieramy poziom i zaczynamy zabawę! Tylko dwa klawisze dodatkowe nie licząc kierunkowych, spacja służy nam do skoków natomiast "V" do chwycenia deski w locie. Z tak prostym sterowaniem dotarcie do mety nie stanowi żadnego wyzwania, ale dotarcie do tej mety w odpowiednim czasie, czy też z odpowiednim wynikiem stanowi już niejednokrotnie przyjemne wyzwanie.
W samej grze jest tylko kilka poziomów z czego pierwsze są bardziej samouczkiem niż rzeczywistą mapą do zabawy, mimo to, ostatnie poziomy dały mi naprawdę masę zabawy. Ciągłe kombinowanie na wykręcenie jak największej ilości trików i to w możliwie jak najkrótszym czasie było naprawdę przyjemnym doświadczeniem, szczególnie że wbudowane poziomy są stworzone tak, że mamy co najmniej kilka "przewidzianych" tras, a możemy je także dowolnie je sobie łączyć, we własną trasę, stąd zabawy nie mogło mi zabraknąć.
Grafika choć prosta to sprawdza się bardzo dobrze, kupione zasoby graficzne w postaci bohaterów nad którymi przejmiemy kontrolę nijak nie zawadzają, chociaż można się zdziwić widząc niektóre postacie jako że występują w innych gierkach (np, bohaterska małpa tutaj, to jeden ze strażników nieskończoności w Tap Tap Heroes), muzyka nie przeszkadza ale i nie zapada w pamięć, przez co osobiście polecam ją wyłączyć i zostawić jedynie efekty dźwiękowe, a za tło muzyczne puścić sobie własne żwawe kawałki.
Rzekłbym że gra nie jest warta swojej ceny jako że przejść ją możemy na 100% w przeciągu jakichś 2h, jednak gra jest wyposażona w wbudowany edytor poziomów i to taki naprawdę niezły edytor, w którym dość szybko można się połapać i zacząć tworzyć całkiem niezłe poziomy własne. Do tego jest także możliwość dzielenia się nimi, zatem tak naprawdę dostajemy grę z nieograniczoną ilością poziomów, a zatem i nieograniczoną ilością zabawy, tym samym cena 9€ jest całkiem sensowna (mimo to polecam najlepiej poczekać na promocję i zgarnąć tą pozycję za połowę ceny, lub jeszcze lepiej w jakimś bundlu)
Gdybym musiał natomiast wymienić jakieś wady, to miałbym mały problem bo jest ich niewiele, ba tylko dwie tak naprawdę przychodzą mi do głowy. Jest to przede wszystkim nie do końca mająca sens działalność otoczenia - czasami zamiast zwyczajnie wjechać pod górkę z jakiegoś dziwnego powodu w nią uderzałem i musiałem zaczynać poziom od nowa. Po za tym sterowanie choć całkiem niezłe to w niektórych poziomach stawało się pewnym wrogiem, ponieważ w ciasnych korytarzach zbyt często odbijałem się od podłoża i kiedy chciałem skręcić to niestety zaczynałem obracać się w około własnej osi na desce jako że co chwila moja postać nieznacznie odbijała się od brzegu góry. Po za tymi drobiazgami do których dość łatwo idzie się dostosować, to naprawdę nie widzę większych błędów.
Tak to jest port z urządzeń mobilnych, ale zrobiony dobrze, z sensem i wręcz po kilku testach uznałem że w wersji pctowej idzie mi znacznie lepiej niż w mobilnej, dzięki dokładniejszemu sterowaniu typowej klawiatury.

Zwróć proszę tylko uwagę na fakt że developer nieco się pomylił przy opisie - To nie jest gra typu "Open World", nie ma tu otwartego świata, są jedynie otwarte pomniejsze poziomy które wybieramy z menu podobnego do tego znanego z Angry Birds czy innych gierek mobilnych.

Jeśli pragniesz dobrze się pobawić na snowboardzie w prostej arcedowej gierce, to dobrze trafiłeś. Jeśli natomiast nie przepadasz za jazdą na desce po śniegu i lodzie, to ta pozycja z pewnością nie zmieni twojego zdania i zwyczajnie ją sobie odpuść. To wszystko.

Pozdrawiam.

Ps. Zapomniałem wspomnieć - choć w grze do wyboru i odblokowania jest kilka postaci, to tak naprawdę nie różnią się one od siebie nijak. To jedynie "skórki". Mimo to zdecydowanie warto odblokować sobie większą ilość postaci i potestować jazdę każdą z nich. Mimo braku różnic w samej fizyce jazdy czy sterowaniu, to każda z postaci wygląda inaczej i zajmuje większą lub mniejszą część ekranu. Stąd chociaż jazda wilkołakiem wygląda naprawdę przyjemnie z boku, to o wiele łatwiej wykręcić większą ilość trików pomniejszą małpką, która z racji swego niewielkiego rozmiaru bardziej pomaga zorientować się w otoczeniu, lepiej ocenić wysokość na którym się znajdujemy etc. Dlatego nie warto pozostawać do końca przy domyślnej postaci ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037166965', 'num_games_owned': 1508, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1442152376}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nHgpiyVr04w
[b] Small personal opinion (review complete in Italian): [/b] 
The game is still in its infancy, I hope that the community create other levels as those inserted are very few.
Also there are still problems in the commands, which are to be improved and the launch price unfortunately does not help, but future updates can improve everything, because the game is quite fun and well done.

[h1]  Rating 6/10 [/h1]

-----------

Mad Snowboard è di Snowboard game molto folle!
Bisogna usare ogni trucco possibile per raggiungere l'obbiettivo, nel gioco c'è la modalità "editor di livelli" dove è possibile creare il proprio livello e condividerlo con la community.
Il gioco integra anche una classifica online dei punteggi più alti ed è possibile giocare fino a quattro giocatori contemporaneamente , in modalità split sceen!

Feature:

Mondo Aperto (i livelli si possono finire in molti approci diversi)
Editor di livelli, si possono creare i livelli
4 Giocatori in split-screen
Classifiche, Replay e modalità fantasma
5 Personaggi sbloccabili ( in base all'esperienza)

Parere personale:
Il gioco è ancora in fase embrionale, spero che la community crei altri livelli poichè quelli inseriti sono molto pochi.
Inoltre ci sono ancora delle problematiche nei comandi, che sono da migliorare e il prezzo di lancio purtroppo non aiuta, ma futuri update possono migliorare il tutto, in quanto poi il gioco riesce nel suo piccolo a divertire.

[h1]  Voto 6/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993157621', 'num_games_owned': 6731, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1447391413}
review:
One of the Best Devs I worked with, He was willing to spend the 2 1/2Hs in Skype with screen sharing, log sharing, and code sharing to work out the issue on the community downloads not working. Everything works as intended now!!!

Ever wanted to know what Cool Boards 1, 2, & 3 on the PSX would be like on the PC.. This is it.. Let the nostalgia begin


Controls 4/5 : Simple to use on a xbox360, a bit more trickery with the keyboard. 
Sound 3/5 Music isn't bad, Sound Effect are basic. All it all it works for the game.. It keep ya going.
Graphics 3/5 Its above average then most Unity Games have.. Nothing special but nothing ugly ether.. The Gameplay makes up for it all
Gameplay 4/5 This is where the game shines.. The game play is solid...for the most part.. Sure, due to some Level designs and the limitation on the Editor you can find yourself doing all sort of weird stuff like shooting right outside the level at ridicules speeds.. The game play is a blast, from speed runs to Racking up trick points... and with the community made levels the replay value is through the roof.. never a dull moment...oh can’t forget the Local 4 players at once on the same screen.. This is a great little party couch game just in time for every one looking at getting a Steam link/machine. 


oh did I mention the LVL editor... board? build your own. Easy to use..

All in all  despite it being built on unity (unreal would have been way better IMO) this game is worth the price tag, from unlimited replay value, Pick up and play and local multiplayer. the only thing missing is Online play.

Overall 4/5

This game doing a lot of fun, is a very fast descent on the track with many twists
The jumps proves to be very demanding, I needed several times a distance to ever come to the finish

author: {'steamid': '76561198009953174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1574192402}
review:
Ein witziges Spiel es erscheint einem auf den ersten Blick fast zu leicht, wenn man aber anfängt sich um die Highscores zu kloppen, dann wird's doch recht schwer (selbst bei den 24h Highscores)! Für ein indie Spiel meiner Meinung nach auf jeden Fall zu empfehlen!

Pro:
+interessante Charaktere (z.B. ein Affe auf einer riesen Banane oder ein Werwolf auf ein paar Holzklötzen)
+Community Levels (es gibt nur 6 eingebaute Level, man wird danach direkt auf die unzähligen Community Level verwiesen)
+Replays anderer Spieler (man kann sich anschauen wie die unglaublichen Highscores zu Stande gekommen sind)
+Level Editor

Contra:
-die Grafik ist nicht besonders gut (gerade bei den Community Levels siehts mager aus)
-das Spiel ist sehr simpel
